location: Nauvis - Crash Site - Copper Furnace Array
summary: Steel finally came online today. It requires wood to produce, which adds yet another demand to an already stretched resource, but it was absolutely worth it.

With enough steel stockpiled, I researched the Steel Pickaxe. The difference is immediate and noticeable. Mining rocks and chopping trees feels almost effortless compared to before. I spent most of the day taking advantage of it, gathering large amounts of stone and wood.

Even though science, steel production, and water treatment all consume wood, I still managed to rebuild a healthy log stockpile. Stone reserves are looking solid again as well. I may continue over-mining slightly just to create a buffer.

I also completed research on the Crusher. Unfortunately, the machines are extremely expensive — 160 stone, 606 iron plates, 60 steel plates, and 452 copper plates per unit. On top of that, I need to properly design a jaw crusher layout before committing resources. That will likely be tomorrow’s main task.

Next research target is Ash Separation. Our centralized ash storage is growing to uncomfortable levels. Hopefully this technology will finally give ash a meaningful purpose instead of just being waste.

One important observation: the starting iron patch is down to 33% remaining. I’m considering dedicating it exclusively to steel production and routing the southern iron deposit into the logistics mall instead — after implementing the jaw crushers.

The jaw crusher upgrade is significant. It improves the iron recipe from 1 plate per 8 ore to 1 plate per 5 ore, and it produces stone as a byproduct. That’s efficiency on both fronts — more iron and supplemental stone. It could fundamentally rebalance the factory.

status.resource: Stone and wood stabilized; starting iron patch at 33%.
status.production: Steel online; preparing for jaw crusher integration.
status.science: Steel pickaxe and Crusher researched; Ash Separation next.
